item.title: Legacy Windows Services on Docker
item.description: Intro Docker and containers are a hot topic in the DevOps community and continue to grow. By now, you can run your containers on Azure, AWS without any prior infrastructure. This post is about legacy services made before containers emerged and when/how to make them run on Docker. When? You’ve probably asked yourself if you should port your legacy applications to run on Docker. In most scenarios, you shouldn’t.

item.title: About
item.description: Me Hi. I’m Zair. 22. I currently work as a Fullstack DevOps Engineer at @Accenture Digital in Rio’s office. Highly interest in serverless architectures, cloud-based environment orchestration, agile tooling and technologies in general. I’m also interest in cryptocurrencies (ethereum classic/monero/decred miner) and blockchain applications, team management, security/privacy.
